message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CR 

The paper proposes a method for detecting Out-of-Distribution (OOD) examples in deep neural networks, which is a common problem in machine learning and computer vision. The method is based on characterizing activity patterns by Gram matrices, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper proposes a method that is applicable across a variety of architectures and vision datasets, which suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
